datavisualization.loading_error: Failed to load the list of workers' total hours records.

how-to-start.title: How to start
how-to-start.content: If you are new to Netuno, start by creating your first form, and confirm the initial configurations.

from-the-root.title: From the Netuno root directory
from-the-root.content:
App directory: apps/demo/

App configurations directory: apps/demo/config/

Services source code directory: apps/demo/server/services

Templates source code directory: apps/demo/server/templates

+ information about folder structure.

calc-hours.title: Calculate Hours
calc-hours.intro: Finds the future time by adding 100 hours on top of the current time. You can change the number of hours in the URL parameter to perform other calculations.

date-format.title: Format Date and Hours
date-format.intro: When working with dates and times it is often necessary to perform the conversion to string and vice-versa so we present some examples of how it can be done.

export-excel.title: Export to Excel
export-excel.intro: Demonstration of how you can export your data to Excel.

export-pdf.title: Export to PDF
export-pdf.intro: Demonstration of how you can export your data to PDF.

user.title: User
user.intro: Displays the currently logged in user information.

group.title: Group
group.intro: Displays the currently logged in user's group information.

mail-send.title: Send Email
mail-send.intro: Example of how to send emails using a Google/GMail account. Replace the ***** (asterisks) by your respective account information in both the code and App configuration at config/.

print-template.title: Templates
print-template.intro: Serves to generate HTML and keep the code clean and tidy, check the contents of the templates in server/templates/samples.

query-parameter.title: Parameters in Database Queries
query-parameter.intro: Uses the passed URL parameters as filters and returns the data found in the database matching the parameters in JSON format.

db.title: Database Transactions
db.intro: Demonstrates how to perform database transactions such as inserts, updates, deletes, and selects by code.

query-interaction.title: Data Iteration
query-interaction.intro: Returns the records found by the query through a for loop in JSON format.

query-result.title: Simple Data Retrieval
query-result.intro: Returns the records found by the query in JSON format.

uid.title: UUID
uid.intro: Generates a uuid/guid which is a random string of unique identification.

remote-delete-json.title: Remote Delete JSON
remote-delete-json.intro: Performs an HTTP remote request of type delete that usually serves to delete a specific entity from the server.

remote-patch-json.title: Remote Patch JSON
remote-patch-json.intro: Performs an HTTP remote request of type patch which is normally used to send data changes.

remote-post-json.title: Remote Post JSON
remote-post-json.intro: Performs an HTTP remote request of type post which is usually used to create or insert new data structures.

remote-put-json.title: Remote Put JSON
remote-put-json.intro: Performs an HTTP remote request of type put which is usually used to set the data, create if it doesn't exist or change otherwise.

remote-get-json.title: Remote Get JSON
remote-get-json.intro: Makes a remote HTTP request of type get that is normally used to get data.

remote-mailjet-sms.title: SMS
remote-mailjet-sms.intro: Demonstrates how to send SMS through an external service, in this case we use the Mailjet service. You'll need to configure the YOUR_TOKEN and the YOUR_INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER fields.
